fields.description: Port the Studio Navbar to Bamboo.
fields.summary: Port Studio Navbar to Bamboo

fields.description:
This plugin point is required for Studio to put in its own headers and footers into Bamboo.  The plugin point should mirror JIRA's plugin point, except it would obviously support freemarker templates, not velocity (we'll be rendering our velocity templates and including the output into the freemarker templates).  For what it should look like see:

https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-jira-plugin/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml?r=37119#l123

I strongly suggest looking up the JIRA source code for these plugin points to work out how they should be implemented.  The current Bamboo headers may need to be converted to plugins, do whatever JIRA does.
fields.summary: Create Bamboo top navigation and footer plugin points

fields.description:
This is a task to create a decorator and decorator mapper plugin point for Bamboo.  The purpose for this is to be able to override the Bamboo admin decorators, to be able to include Bamboo admin screens in the Studio Global Admin.  For a guide on what needs to be done, how to do it etc, most of the code can be copied from the decorator plugin point in JIRA:

https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/jira?cs=78027

Included in there is a BufferingRequestDispatcher, this was needed to include JSPs in templates, but is probably not needed in Bamboo because it uses FreeMarker templates, and FreeMarker templates have their own mechanism for importing other FreeMarker templates.  Another thing that may or may not be needed is a FreeMarker version of the Velocity decorator servlet.  This was only included so that you could specify a velocity decorator template to forward to, but we don't actually use that in Studio, we have our own global admin servlet, which may be what we use in Bamboo too.
fields.summary: Create decorator plugin point for Bamboo

fields.description: For activity in Subversion (eg. "Joe Smith committed changeset 195 to the Foo Project project saying:"...) and Crucible, the name is hyperlinked, but the hyperlink is wrong, eg.: http://<instance>.jira.com/secure/jsmith
fields.summary: Activity stream username links broken for subversion and crucible activity
Update Streams to also support Confluence 3.0
SVN Permission manager changes root permissions instead of project permissions of newly created projects

fields.description:
Raised on behalf of a customer:

When in the Issues tab, JIRA has a "Find Issues" link taking you directly to JIRA's search interface.  However there is no equivalent link in the Wiki tab taking you to Confluence's search page.  The only way to get to it is by doing a quicksearch, scrolling down to the Wiki results and clicking the link to further search results.

If it's simple to add, it might be a good idea to add a "Search" link, as a quick way to get to Confluence's search UI.
fields.summary: Add a "Search" tab in Wiki tab

fields.description: Crowd allows for things such as password strength and expiration. According to Dave Oflynn, we should be able (with some work) to allow configuration of these rules from JIRA to Crowd. Let's find a way to expose these controls to customers.
fields.summary: Enforce password rules

fields.description:
After using the Quick Search, Studio returns a list of JIRA, Confluence and Fisheye issues.  At the end of the JIRA results the "Showing X of Y issues" text is hyperlinked to a JIRA search. Eg. searching for "foo":

http://test.jira.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=show&summary=true&description=true&body=true&searchString=foo

Clicking on this, JIRA ignores the entered search string and returns all issues.

This is because the URL uses 'searchString' whereas JIRA 3.13.x uses 'query'.
fields.summary: JIRA additional search results link loses search request filter

fields.description:
Say I have a Fisheye project FOO, and set its path to FOO/bar.  The Subversion repository manager claims to be setting permissions for FOO/bar:

On this page you can edit the permissions for the Foo project with path FOO/bar 

But actually the authz file only uses FOO
fields.summary: Subversion permission manager does not use Fisheye repository path in written authz file

fields.description: Allow Bamboo builds to be kicked off from JIRA workflow state change
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo builds to be kicked off from JIRA workflow state change

fields.description:
include big warning prompt that alerts them that the navigation bar will not work with the new space.
if they select an alternate theme, include warning prompt that the navigation bar will not be displayed for the space.
fields.summary: allow customers to create spaces that aren't associated with a project

fields.description: Allow customers to select non-studio themes. Add a big warning prompt saying 'selecting this theme will cause the Studio [Navigation Bar] to disappear from this space. Do you want to continue?'
fields.summary: allow customers to select alternate themes in Wiki

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Configuring+Repository+Permissions+for+a+Project
in Screenshot: 'Subversion Permission Manager'
it says "The projects are grouped by category where applicable"
they actually aren't; this text will be fixed in 1.8 (I'm doing it now), so we will probably need a new screenshot
fields.summary: New screenshot for subversion permission manager

fields.description:
New Studio hosts have a GreenHopper link, but clicking on it results in a stacktrace: HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [GreenHopper]:Action 'GreenHopper' not found or could not be initialized: Class not found

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Action 'GreenHopper' not found or could not be initialized: Class not found at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory$JiraPluginActionFactory.getActionImpl(JiraActionFactory.java:295) at webwork.action.factory.ScriptActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ScriptActionFactoryProxy.java:54) at webwork.action.factory.XMLActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(XMLActionFactoryProxy.java:54) at webwork.action.factory.PrefixActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(PrefixActionFactoryProxy.java:102) at 

When a new Studio host comes up, the last upgrade task to run is:

2009-06-01 12:10:59.103999500 2009-06-01 12:10:59,103 TP-Processor2 INFO [sal.jira.upgrade.JiraPluginUpgrader] Plugin com.atlassian.studio.theme.jira upgrade completed. Current version is: 42

However just like when enabling the plugin through the web interface, JIRA requires a restart before the plugin will work.
fields.summary: Greenhopper broken by default in Studio 1.7.1.1

fields.description: Additional search results link does not apply to specific search.  If I conduct a search and receive 14 results the first batch of links are revelant.  However, if I click on the link to see the remaining search results it returns every ticket created in the entire system (over 1000) and does not bring up the batch of relevant returns.
fields.summary: Additional search results link not relevant to search

fields.description: We shouldn't use user hover in any one app until we have it in all apps. Lets figure out a way to disable it in confluence when we upgrade to 3.0
fields.summary: disable user hover

These changesets were created by me (kbrazulewicz) but I consistently see sleberrigaud in the logs:
https://studio.atlassian.com/source/changelog/SAL?cs=36874
https://studio.atlassian.com/source/changelog/SAL?cs=36875
fields.summary: Wrong userid in subversion logs on studio.atlassian.com for certain changesets

fields.description:
It seems impossible to have more than one project associated with a Fisheye repository.

To replicate:

 - Create a new project, FOO
 - Go to Administration -> Source -> Project Permissions (http://$host.jira.com/secure/admin/RepositoryProjectList.jspa). The Project Key and Path values will both be FOO.
 - In the projet admin page, set both the Subversion Repository and Fisheye Repository applinks to another Fisheye project, in my case, one used by another project.
 - Refresh the Project Permissions page.  It still shows the old project key/path.
fields.summary: Cannot associate a project with another's Fisheye repository

fields.description:
To replicate:
1) Create projects A and B

On B's project admin page, you should see:

Subversion Repository: B (svn)  ( Select  | Manage Permissions  ) 

Click 'Select' and change the Subversion repository to A.

Now click "Manage Permissions".  You would expect to be editing permissions for Subversion repository A, but actually you are editing those for B.
fields.summary: SVN manage permissions does not work when project associated with another's repository

fields.description: PreCommitHookManagerImpl currently just throws an exception if it can't retrieve the hook directory location from the properties file. It should use a sensible default instead.
fields.summary: Pre commit hooks manager should use a sensible default

fields.description:
Currently if a Studio instance allows users to sign themselves up, then these users are created as Collaborators.  For open source instances, new users should be able to see the source code, and so should be Developers.

It would be good if this were configurable via a system property.
fields.summary: Make whether self signed-up users are Collaborators or Developers configurable

fields.description: When I load a Studio instance with a normal amount of content, and the default dashboard displaying the activity stream, Firefox freezes for about 20 seconds as the activity stream renders.
fields.summary: Activity stream freezes the browser for up to 20s

fields.description:
Studio's Confluence used to display a section with a link to the People Directory:

!https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/11262/11262_conf_dashboardlinks.png!

This has vanished in recent releases, so a part of Confluence's functionality has effectively disappeared.
fields.summary: Link to People Directory has disappeared

fields.description: Upgrade Confluence to 3.0
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence to 3.0

fields.description:
For many customers, JIRA's workflow is the first thing to be customized, and having just the default workflow conditions and post-functions is very limiting.   The Misc Workflow Extensions plugin is a fairly stable, popular set that customers have requested:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Misc+Workflow+Extensions
fields.summary: Plugin request: Misc Workflow Extensions

fields.description:
In Administration -> Issues -> Global Settings -> General Configuration there is a "Use gzip compression" option. Confluence has an equivalent "Compress HTTP responses" option.  Enabling this is unnecessary, because Apache is already doing compression, and when this flag is enabled it somehow confuses IE 6 (but not other browsers):

!broken-ie6.png|thumbnail!

Lots of people have encountered this problem, so we should prevent people from enabling the GZip compression flag.
fields.summary: Prevent people from enabling GZip compression

fields.description:
Go into Chart Board and select to print a chart the following stack trace is printed: 

{noformat}Exception rendering velocity file templates/greenhopper/jira/boards/charts/chart-print.vm
org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Could not find template 'templates/greenhopper/jira/boards/charts/chart-print.vm' ensure it is in the classpath.
at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:86)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webwork.JiraPluginWebworkVelocityServlet.service(JiraPluginWebworkVelocityServlet.java:46)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803)
{noformat}

This is because we aren't including the template in the greenhopper plugin:

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:greenhopper]$ ls templates/greenhopper/jira/boards/charts/
burndown.vm           chart-confirmation.vm non-working-days.vm
chart-board.vm        curves-settings.vm
{noformat}

Looks like its fixed on the test site, but I couldn't find an issue for it, so raising this one.
fields.summary: Printing of Charts in Greenhopper is broken

fields.description: Request to install [Issue Linker and Link Searcher plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5000]
fields.summary: Bundle the JIRA Issue Linker and Searcher plugin
Release Studio 1.7.1

However the characters are rendered properly in Fisheye/Crucible
fields.summary: Non English characters rendered incorrectly in the activity stream for Source

fields.description:
If you click on the username in the activity stream for source activities, the link is broken. 

The link will go to something like  https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/username instead of https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=username

This happens on StAC and customer instances.
fields.summary: User profile links are broken in the Activity Stream for Fisheye/Crucible/svn items.

fields.description:
The workflow engine in Studio is so much more restricted than the Jira. It would be nice to have some additional plugin functions, such as:

*JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions*
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Misc+Workflow+Extensions

It would also be great if we could use edit XML
fields.summary: Improve the workflow engine and accessibilty

fields.summary: Stack trace thrown when clicking "login" on crucible when you are already authenticated but don't have permission to view reviews

fields.description: Clicking on the more results link in the search results page for Issues.  Expected results are to go to JIRA search page and see the same number of results as indicated on search results page.  Actual is that the search term is not passed, and so it shows all issues in that project.  Instead of seeing the 23 issues related to search, JIRA displays 1600+ tickets.
fields.summary: Search is broken - more results link doesn't pass search terms

fields.description:
Instead of listing just the administrators, studio instances are shows all users. I'm not sure when this started but it doesn't happen with a standalone install of JIRA. 

You can see this on our own instances as well as customer instances.
fields.summary: Administrator List shows all users

fields.description:
Since JIRA is installed in the root of a studio instance it won't send trackbacks to confluence. 

This is because JIRA has an exclude list of hosts not to send trackbacks to and by default it hardcodes the JIRA base URL in the exclude list.  

I've raised [JRA-17183|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-17183] in order to track this issue in JIRA.
fields.summary: Trackback pings from JIRA to Confluence don't work on studio instances

fields.description:
Customer requested the JIRA Calendar Plugin be installed on their studio instance

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Calendar+Plugin
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar Plugin installation

fields.description:
Ref: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1147

Please add a request to every release of JIRA Studio to upgrade all plugins to the latest level.

GreenHopper is a popular and very close family friend of Atlassian (did I hear any rumors of acquisition?) and should be part of every Studio release.
fields.summary: upgrade all plugins for every studio release

fields.description:
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/294

Including functional tests, admin links, etc.
fields.summary: Bundle the JIRA Timesheet Report and Portlet Plugin by Andriy Zhdanov

fields.description: I would like to trigger a Crucible review in a workflow schema.
fields.summary: Workflows: Trigger a Crucible Review

fields.description: I would like a NOT operator to the workflow "Condition To Transition."  For example, I need to create a condition where the assignee cannot be the one to transition to the next phase. The reason is I have to ensure that once a developer resolves the task, another developer must be the one to close it after he QA's it.
fields.summary: Workflows: Add a NOT operator to the "Condition To Transition" and Validators.

fields.description: Whenever I want to add a transition to a workflow, I cannot select an existing one. Instead I have to create a new one. So in one workflow I was working on, I had 3 different "Close Issue" transitions that did exactly the same thing. Since I had to make a few changes, I had to edit each one, every time. An alternative would be to allow XML-based editing or importing of the workflow.
fields.summary: Workflows: When adding transition, allow selecting from existing transitions.

fields.description: Hide sysadmin contegix and atlassian users from non-sysadmins, if possible.
fields.summary: Hide sysadmin contegix and atlassian users from non-sysadmins

fields.description: Seeing as though we make it possible to use the GreenHopper Plugin for JIRA with JIRA Studio it makes sense that we should make it possible to use the [GreenPepper Plugin|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/confluence/display/GP/GreenPepper+Server] for Confluence with JIRA Studio.
fields.summary: Make GreenPepper Plugin available to JIRA Studio customers

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a lot of projects and I think it would be interesting to be able to easily locate all issues related to of groups projects. 

The project categories, I only recently discovered, rock - so I was thinking what about having the 'Find Issues' having a box with the categories so one could swiftly pick project categories.

I hope you find the idea useful,

jonasbn
fields.summary: Extending the issue search possibilities

fields.description:
All the links on the view project screen point to "/secure/project/blah".  However, when the same screens are navigated to by going through the admin menus, you end up on "/secure/admin/blah".  This causes grief for our reverse mappings of admin screens to web items, which in most cases only has the "/secure/admin/blah" path mapped, and so results in the wrong tab/menu item being highlighted.  The mappings need to be overhauled such that web items are mapped for both possible paths.

I suggest such that this be a programmatic thing, instead of calling addWebItem in the path mapper initialiser, call addJiraAdminWebItem.  Some URLs (green hopper configuration screens) map to neither, these need to be taken into consideration.
fields.summary: Links clicked to from the project details screen result in the wrong tab being highligted

fields.description:
The new unified administration menu certainly looks prettier, but it is a usability disaster. Performing everyday JIRA administration tasks now requires almost twice the number of mouse clicks and server roundtrips.

There are two general problems I see:

1) All the menu items are closed by default, meaning that:
 - Users now have to decipher JIRA's top-level menu names, which often bear little relation to what they contain. Eg. to get to permission schemes you click 'Global Settings', not 'Permissions', and 'Workflows' are in 'Global Settings' but 'Workflow Schemes' are in 'Schemes'.
 -  Menus can no longer be quickly navigated to by keyboard searching.
 - Clicking on a menu section requires a roundrip to the server, and closes the old section. it's like 1999 all over again.  Opening a section also opens the first page in that section. Thus clicking 'Global Settings' opens.. the 'Project Role Browser' page - confusing when all you want to do is see the menu items.

2) The JIRA 'projects' admin screen now lives under the 'General' tab, not the 'Issues' tab. Doing any administrative task in JIRA requires frequent trips to the projects admin page.  This means that one has to keep switch tabs to get anything done. It also leads to menu inconsistencies, eg. if you click on a project, then click 'Edit' to edit its permission scheme, you're still in the 'General' tab.  However if you navigate to the same permission scheme via Issues -> Schemes -> Permission Schemes -> Edit, you're in the 'Issues' tab.
fields.summary: New administration layout makes doing anything much slower

fields.summary: sub-nav display issue on IE

fields.description:
For some reason we bundle the unsupported [JIRA Confluence Portlet|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Confluence+Portlet] with Studio.  When a Confluence page is added to the JIRA dashboard, all the page links are incorrect, with /wiki twice, ie http://<host>.jira.com/wiki/wiki/display/....

This is a known bug ([JCP-3|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JCP-3]).
fields.summary: JIRA Confluence Portlet links broken

fields.description:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1072

The folks at Second Market (portal.secondmarket.com) would like an updated GreenHopper plugin installed in JIRA Studio.  They mentioned 3.5, but 3.6 is the latest release.  Thanks, and let us know if further information is needed.

--
Ryan Woodsmall
Atlassian Hosted Support
fields.summary: Update GreenHopper plugin to 3.5+
